qas.question: Why would IT security partake in malpractice?

context: <a2_0><a4_0><b10_0>Computer security<b10_0/><a4_0/><a2_0/>, also known as <a1_0>cybersecurity or IT security<a1_0/>, is <b5_0>the protection of information systems from theft or damage<b5_0/> to the hardware, <b7_0>the software, and to the information on them,<b7_0/> as well as from disruption or misdirection of the <b12_0>services<b12_0/> they provide. It includes <b9_0>controlling physical access to the hardware, as well as <b6_0>protecting against harm<b6_0/> that may come via network access<b9_0/>, <b8_0><b13_0>data and code injection<b13_0/>, and due to malpractice by operators<b8_0/>, whether <a3_0><b14_0>intentional, accidental, or due to them being tricked<b14_0/><a3_0/> into deviating from <a0_0><b11_0>secure<b11_0/> procedures<a0_0/>.
